greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=0 if n is in A259934, otherwise 1 + number of steps to reach the farthest leaf in that finite branch of the tree defined by edge-relation A049820(child) = parent.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..17724
formula: If A262693(n) = 1 [when n is in A259934],
otherwise, if A060990(n) = 0 [when n is one of the leaves, A045765],
(In the last clause [ ] stands for Iverson bracket, giving as its result 1 only when A049820(k) = n, and 0 otherwise).
example: For n=1, its transitive closure (as defined by edge-relation A049820(child) = parent) is the union of {1} itself together with all its descendants: {1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8}. We see that there are no other nodes in this subtree whose root is 1, because A049820(3) = 3 - d(3) = 1, A049820(4) = 1, A049820(5) = 3, A049820(7) = 5, A049820(8) = 4 and of these only 7 and 8 are terms of A045765 (leaves). Starting iterating from 7 with A049820, we get 7 -> 5, 5 -> 3, 3 -> 1, and starting from 8 we get 8 -> 4, 4 -> 1, of which the former path is longer (3 steps), thus a(1) = 3+1 = 4.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 04 2015
